query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 ‘Deus, venerunt gentes’, alternando 2 or tre or quattro dolce salmodia, 3 le donne incominciaro, e lagrimando;

Please translate each line literally into English.
4 e Bëatrice, sospirosa e pia, 5 quelle ascoltava sì fatta, che poco 6 più a la croce si cambiò Maria.
query.result: 4 and Beatrice, sighing and devout, 5 listened to them in such a way that little 6 more did Mary change at the cross.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Ma poi che l’altre vergini dier loco 8 a lei di dir, levata dritta in pè, 9 rispuose, colorata come foco:
query.result: 7 But after the other virgins gave place 8 for her to speak, having risen to her feet, 9 she replied, flushed as fire:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 ‘Modicum, et non videbitis me; 11 et iterum, sorelle mie dilette, 12 modicum, et vos videbitis me’.

Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Poi le si mise innanzi tutte e sette, 14 e dopo sé, solo accennando, mosse 15 me e la donna e ’l savio che ristette.
query.result: 13 Then she placed herself in front of all seven, 14 and after her, with just a nod, she beckoned 15 me and the lady and the sage who remained behind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Così sen giva; e non credo che fosse 17 lo decimo suo passo in terra posto, 18 quando con li occhi li occhi mi percosse;

Please translate each line literally into English.
19 e con tranquillo aspetto «Vien più tosto», 20 mi disse, «tanto che, s’io parlo teco, 21 ad ascoltarmi tu sie ben disposto».
query.result: 19 and with a tranquil gaze she said to me, “Come more quickly, 20 so that, if I speak to you, 21 you may be well-disposed to listen to me.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Sì com’ io fui, com’ io dovëa, seco, 23 dissemi: «Frate, perché non t’attenti 24 a domandarmi omai venendo meco?».
query.result: 22 As soon as I was, as I should be, beside her, 23 she said to me: “Brother, why do you not dare 24 to ask me questions now that you are coming with me?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Come a color che troppo reverenti 26 dinanzi a suo maggior parlando sono, 27 che non traggon la voce viva ai denti,
query.result: 25 Like someone who is too reverent 26 when speaking before his superior, 27 so that he cannot force the living voice from his teeth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 avvenne a me, che sanza intero suono 29 incominciai: «Madonna, mia bisogna 30 voi conoscete, e ciò ch’ad essa è buono».
query.result: 28 it happened to me that without a complete sound 29 I began: “My lady, you know my need 30 and what is good for it.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Ed ella a me: «Da tema e da vergogna 32 voglio che tu omai ti disviluppe, 33 sì che non parli più com’ om che sogna.
query.result: 31 And she to me: "From fear and from shame 32 I want you now to free yourself, 33 so that you no longer speak like one who dreams.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Sappi che ’l vaso che ’l serpente ruppe, 35 fu e non è; ma chi n’ha colpa, creda 36 che vendetta di Dio non teme suppe.
query.result: 34 Know that the vessel that the serpent broke 35 was and is not; but whoever is to blame for it, let him believe 36 that God’s vengeance does not fear bribes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Non sarà tutto tempo sanza reda 38 l’aguglia che lasciò le penne al carro, 39 per che divenne mostro e poscia preda;

Please translate each line literally into English.
40 ch’io veggio certamente, e però il narro, 41 a darne tempo già stelle propinque, 42 secure d’ogn’ intoppo e d’ogne sbarro,
query.result: 40 for I see certainly, and therefore I declare it, 41 that propitious stars are already aligning to give us the time, 42 free from every obstacle and every barrier,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 nel quale un cinquecento diece e cinque, 44 messo di Dio, anciderà la fuia 45 con quel gigante che con lei delinque.
query.result: 43 in which a five hundred, ten and five, 44 sent by God, will kill the prostitute 45 with that giant who sins with her.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 E forse che la mia narrazion buia, 47 qual Temi e Sfinge, men ti persuade, 48 perch’ a lor modo lo ’ntelletto attuia;

Please translate each line literally into English.
49 ma tosto fier li fatti le Naiade, 50 che solveranno questo enigma forte 51 sanza danno di pecore o di biade.
query.result: 49 but soon the Naiads will be fierce, 50 who will solve this difficult riddle 51 without harm to sheep or crops.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Tu nota; e sì come da me son porte, 53 così queste parole segna a’ vivi 54 del viver ch’è un correre a la morte.
query.result: 52 Take note; and just as they are spoken by me, 53 so mark these words for the living 54 of the life that is a race towards death.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 E aggi a mente, quando tu le scrivi, 56 di non celar qual hai vista la pianta 57 ch’è or due volte dirubata quivi.
query.result: 55 And keep in mind, when you write them down, 56 not to conceal what you have seen of the plant 57 that has now been robbed twice here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Qualunque ruba quella o quella schianta, 59 con bestemmia di fatto offende a Dio, 60 che solo a l’uso suo la creò santa.
query.result: 58 Whoever steals that or tears it up, 59 with the very act offends God, 60 who created it holy for his use alone.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Per morder quella, in pena e in disio 62 cinquemilia anni e più l’anima prima 63 bramò colui che ’l morso in sé punio.
query.result: 61 To bite that, in punishment and desire, 62 for five thousand years and more the first soul 63 yearned for him who punished the bite in himself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Dorme lo ’ngegno tuo, se non estima 65 per singular cagione esser eccelsa 66 lei tanto e sì travolta ne la cima.
query.result: 64 Your intellect is asleep, if it does not consider 65 that for a singular reason she is so exalted 66 and so turned upside down at the top.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 E se stati non fossero acqua d’Elsa 68 li pensier vani intorno a la tua mente, 69 e ’l piacer loro un Piramo a la gelsa,
query.result: 67 And if the vain thoughts around your mind 68 had not been like the Elsa’s water, 69 and their pleasure a Pyramus to the mulberry,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 per tante circostanze solamente 71 la giustizia di Dio, ne l’interdetto, 72 conosceresti a l’arbor moralmente.
query.result: 70 through so many circumstances alone 71 you would recognize God’s justice, in the interdict, 72 morally in the tree.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Ma perch’ io veggio te ne lo ’ntelletto 74 fatto di pietra e, impetrato, tinto, 75 sì che t’abbaglia il lume del mio detto,
query.result: 73 But because I see you in your intellect 74 turned to stone and, hardened, stained, 75 so that the light of my words dazzles you,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 voglio anco, e se non scritto, almen dipinto, 77 che ’l te ne porti dentro a te per quello 78 che si reca il bordon di palma cinto».
query.result: 76 I also want, and if not written, at least painted, 77 that you carry it within you for that 78 for which one carries a staff encircled with palm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 E io: «Sì come cera da suggello, 80 che la figura impressa non trasmuta, 81 segnato è or da voi lo mio cervello.
query.result: 79 And I: “Just as sealing wax, 80 which does not change the imprinted figure, 81 my brain is now marked by you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Ma perché tanto sovra mia veduta 83 vostra parola disïata vola, 84 che più la perde quanto più s’aiuta?».
query.result: 82 But why so far above my sight 83 does your desired word fly, 84 who loses it more the more he helps himself?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 «Perché conoschi», disse, «quella scuola 86 c’hai seguitata, e veggi sua dottrina 87 come può seguitar la mia parola;

Please translate each line literally into English.
88 e veggi vostra via da la divina 89 distar cotanto, quanto si discorda 90 da terra il ciel che più alto festina».
query.result: 88 and see your way from the divine 89 to be so far, as much as one disagrees 90 from the earth the sky which hastens higher”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Ond’ io rispuosi lei: «Non mi ricorda 92 ch’i’ stranïasse me già mai da voi, 93 né honne coscïenza che rimorda».
query.result: 91 Whereupon I replied to her: “I do not recall 92 that I ever estranged myself from you, 93 nor is there any conscience that bites me.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 «E se tu ricordar non te ne puoi», 95 sorridendo rispuose, «or ti rammenta 96 come bevesti di Letè ancoi;

Please translate each line literally into English.
97 e se dal fummo foco s’argomenta, 98 cotesta oblivïon chiaro conchiude 99 colpa ne la tua voglia altrove attenta.
query.result: 97 and if fire is inferred from smoke, 98 this forgetfulness clearly concludes 99 that your desire was intent elsewhere.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Veramente oramai saranno nude 101 le mie parole, quanto converrassi 102 quelle scovrire a la tua vista rude».
query.result: 100 Truly, my words will now be plain, 101 as much as it will be necessary 102 to reveal them to your unrefined sight.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 E più corusco e con più lenti passi 104 teneva il sole il cerchio di merigge, 105 che qua e là, come li aspetti, fassi,
query.result: 103 And the sun, with slower steps and more radiant, 104 held the circle of midday, 105 which here and there, as the aspects are,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 quando s’affisser, sì come s’affigge 107 chi va dinanzi a gente per iscorta 108 se trova novitate o sue vestigge,
query.result: 106 becomes, when they fixed their gaze, just as one fixes his gaze 107 who goes before people as a guide 108 if he finds something new or its traces,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 le sette donne al fin d’un’ombra smorta, 110 qual sotto foglie verdi e rami nigri 111 sovra suoi freddi rivi l’alpe porta.
query.result: 109 the seven ladies at the end of a faint shadow, 110 such as the Alps bear over their cold streams 111 under green leaves and dark branches.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Dinanzi ad esse Ëufratès e Tigri 113 veder mi parve uscir d’una fontana, 114 e, quasi amici, dipartirsi pigri.
query.result: 112 Before them, it seemed to me that the Euphrates and Tigris 113 emerged from a single source, 114 and, like friends, lazily parted ways.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 «O luce, o gloria de la gente umana, 116 che acqua è questa che qui si dispiega 117 da un principio e sé da sé lontana?».
query.result: 115 “O light, O glory of the human race, 116 what is this water that here unfolds 117 from a single source and yet is distant from itself?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Per cotal priego detto mi fu: «Priega 119 Matelda che ’l ti dica». E qui rispuose, 120 come fa chi da colpa si dislega,
query.result: 118 To such a request it was said to me: “Ask 119 Matelda to tell you.” And here she replied, 120 as one who frees himself from blame,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 la bella donna: «Questo e altre cose 122 dette li son per me; e son sicura 123 che l’acqua di Letè non gliel nascose».
query.result: 121 the beautiful lady: “This and other things 122 were told to him by me; and I am certain 123 that the water of Lethe did not hide them from him.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 E Bëatrice: «Forse maggior cura, 125 che spesse volte la memoria priva, 126 fatt’ ha la mente sua ne li occhi oscura.
query.result: 124 And Beatrice: “Perhaps a greater concern, 125 which often deprives the memory, 126 has darkened his mind in his eyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Ma vedi Eünoè che là diriva: 128 menalo ad esso, e come tu se’ usa, 129 la tramortita sua virtù ravviva».
query.result: 127 But see Eunoe, which flows there: 128 lead him to it, and as is your custom, 129 revive his weakened virtue.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Come anima gentil, che non fa scusa, 131 ma fa sua voglia de la voglia altrui 132 tosto che è per segno fuor dischiusa;

Please translate each line literally into English.
133 così, poi che da essa preso fui, 134 la bella donna mossesi, e a Stazio 135 donnescamente disse: «Vien con lui».
query.result: 133 so, after I was taken by her, 134 the beautiful lady moved, and to Statius 135 she said graciously: “Come with him.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 S’io avessi, lettor, più lungo spazio 137 da scrivere, i’ pur cantere’ in parte 138 lo dolce ber che mai non m’avria sazio;

Please translate each line literally into English.
139 ma perché piene son tutte le carte 140 ordite a questa cantica seconda, 141 non mi lascia più ir lo fren de l’arte.
query.result: 139 but because all the pages 140 woven for this second canticle are full, 141 the bridle of art allows me to go no further.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 Io ritornai da la santissima onda 143 rifatto sì come piante novelle 144 rinovellate di novella fronda,
query.result: 142 I returned from the most holy wave 143 remade, just as new plants 144 are renewed with new leaves,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
145 puro e disposto a salire a le stelle.
query.result: 145 pure and ready to ascend to the stars.
